channel.title: Friends of Gabe on Gabe Kangas
channel.description: Recent content in Friends of Gabe on Gabe Kangas

item.title: Closest friends of Gabe #tweetdinner
item.description: I'm certainly on a kick lately of wanting to take part in some social experimentation. So when this idea came to mind, I couldn't pass it up. The other day I jumped on a new Tweeter stats type thing. There's hundreds of them. This one is twitteranalyzer.com. After it analyzed my online social circle it determined who my "closest friends" were. Although all awesome people, they're not the people I've spent the most time with.

item.title: Where friendship and responsibility collides in a community
item.description: In the years I've had this blog I've rearely talked about the nitty-gritty of running an IRC channel. In theory, there's not much to it. But in reality, it's a community of people, many who have been there for many, many years. This is where a large group of my friends are. All types of people from all over the world. But lately the topic of respect and seniority has been brought up more and more often.

item.title: Breaking news: Big Omaha proves how awesome Gabe is
item.description: Big Omaha is a success. No doubt. The friendships that were built, the inspiration that filled multiple venues. It's a story that will be retold many times for the next year. But the real story took place online yesterday, when it was discussed how really awesome I am. Names hidden to protect the innocent. [17:56] <OldFriend1> NewFriend from omaha? [17:56] <NewFriend> yep [17:57] <NewFriend> we met at the Big Omaha thing [17:57] <OldFriend2> ohhh [17:57] <OldFriend2> what did you think of gabe?

item.title: Six months of being an Omahan ( #bigomaha )
item.description: So this week marks six months of living in Omaha. I can't help but look back to a simple blog post I made on August 1st, 2008. I wrote "Do I want to move to Omaha? Not really." Now flash forward to May 2009 where my journey in Omaha has so little to do with the reason I came here in the first place. It's mostly about the people for me.
